page.title: 01INTRODUCTION/Landscape
page.content: The 8 figure grid reference gave us a rectangle 4 miles S.W. of Market Harborough, which is a market town in the East Midlands. The area includes the village of Clipson as its main focus of habitation, as well as the site of the Battle of Naseby, which took place in 1645. Seven farms are included in the rectangle, with many acres of arable farmland between them. The terrain is gently undulating with the land at between 129 and 192 metres above sea level. The River Ise flows SW to NE through the area. The main road serving the area is the B4036 which runs from Market Harborough to Daventry. All others are minor roads. Ours can undoubtably be described as a rural landscape.
